ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Juktibadi Sanaskritik Sanstha was formed by a few enthusiast young students in their twenties in1986 in Canning. Canning is the largest biodiversity area of world near Sunderbans, the home of Royal Bengal tigers and variety of snakes. JSSC constantly adopted new approaches to reach the local people over these years to eradicate superstitions, ignorance and educate them about their environments. JSSC published books on snake maps of 24 Paraganas, Bengal and India. Over the years JSSC published books on superstitions, common diseases etc. During 2008 and 2012, JSSC surveyed snakebite victims in all the districts in 24 Paragans covering more than 9 Lacs families. In 2013, JSSC started a after school program for young school going children in their neighbourhood. And also did setup medical camps to check general health of the children, giving vaccines, eye examinations etc.Â

ngoList.title: KALA KUSHALI
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Kala Kushali was founded on 9th March 1981 with some young educated theatre lovers who were always animated about Social ,Economic and political situation prevalent at that point of time. They were also conscious about the history of Bengali Theatre World whereby, many past Theatre personalities enriched Bengali Theatre. They step by step entered on their mission to promote Bengali Theatre under the leadership and guidance of Sri Sibaji Gupta, nephew of famous Dramatist, Director, & Actor Sri Mahendra Gupta. For promotion of the Bengali Theatre, they started performing plays from classical to modern dramas and gained a lot of accomplishment and as well as support from various sections of people. During this long journey of 35 years, they presented and performed 14 plays all were categorically novel respecting Nationâ€™s rich taste and tradition viz. RATER ATITHI, NAYA PATHSHALA,ATATAYI,PARABAS,HARIKATH,BATUR JIBANE PISTOL O REVOLVER,JAYSA KA TYASA,MAHANISHA,MUKHOMUKHI,TIKTIKI,SAHASA,DARPAN,JANAYIKA & latest staged ICHCHA PATRA. In the year 1983 the drama NAYA PATHSHALA was awarded as Best Production by All India Drama Competition organized at Bata Nagar Sports Club. The same drama also won awards in the category of Best Director, Best Actress and Best Actor. Kala Kushali organized a drama festival in association of Ajitesh Natya Academy in the year 1987. A yearly Theatre Magazine named as KALA KUSHALI NATYA PATRIKA is being regularly published in every Sharadiya Mahalaya. The writings of reputed and famous Theatre personalities are being published therein. And Every year on 9th March they organize the Foundation day of the Group and publish SMARAK PATRIKA Magazine which specifically provides an opportunity to its readers to know about their past and present cultural activities. Kalakushali registered under Society Registration Act, 1961 has been performing its legal obligation and are always bound to follow necessary statutory compliances under the said Act.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Kathakriti, a renowned theatrical group of Kolkata, took its birth nearly twenty years back, in the year 1989. It was established by some talented the enthusiastic young theatre workers and appeared in limelite at Bijan Theatre of Kolkata on 10th March 1989, with some programmes on theatre. Thereafter it has been travelling many a path in the field of theatre and culture with glorious success. In such journey, Kathakriti has been supported by Sangeet Natak Akademi, Deptt. of Culture, Govt. of India, Paschim Banga Natya Akademi, I&CA Deptt. Govt. of West Bengal, National School of Drama and other theatre organizations and persons of different fields. Since inception Kathakriti has in its bag, so many successful productions amongst them mentionable are SonarChabi, Kanamama(awarded Dishari Puraskar for best direction), Chhutir Khela(awarded Hritwik Ghatak Memorial award for best direction and production), Ayudh(Awarded Dishari Puraskar for best direction), Mononiketan, Shattru Samppati(Awarded best play wirte by Paschim Banga Natya Akademi), Amrita Atit, Jambo, Octopas Limited, Sei to Tomar Alo, Chandroloke Agnikando, Shraman, Shankranti etc. Kathariti presented their productions on different stages in Kolkata and other districts of West Bengal and some provinces of the coutnry, went to Bangladesh also with the troupe. Kathakriti participated in different drama festivals being organized by themselves and other theatrical groups and Paschim Banga Natya Akademi and National School of Drama. All these performences are wide applause from all cross section of the audience, which is the most staple force that kept Kathakriti going ahead without any break. Besides productions of plays Kathakriti has been publishing Smarak Natya Patra every year besides special issues on Ajitesh Bandopadhyay and Mamata Chattopadhyay wherein the articles are being written by the eminent theatre personalities in their fields. The seminars are being arranged regularly on different topics of theatre every year. Ajitesh Smarak Baktrita have been arranged thirteen times till March 2009. Kathakriti believes that theatre and threatre only can add such zest to life and humanity which is divine in our mortal environment.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Gobardanga KATHA PRASANGA is out and out a fulltime theatre troupe and one of the most eminent groups of Bengali theatre fraternity, that has been devoted to the production and performance of theatre since 2000 and it would not be any exaggeration to say that KATHA PRASANGA, through all its successful stage performances in West Bengal as well as outside West Bengal, Seminars, Natya Utsav, and Theatre Workshops, has won a place of distinction in the theatre movement. This institution firmly believes that despite mixed influences of lost of media, stage performances of theatre definitely leave a lasting impression upon the present generations and can mould and nature the mind feelings of the theatre-lovers, to a great extent.However, KATHA PRASANGA starts its journey through the productions â€˜Sankrantiâ€™ in the year 2001. Then presented itâ€™s notable productions, like â€˜Devotar Grassâ€™ (Rabindra Nathâ€™s pome), â€˜Ukiler Buddhiâ€™ â€˜Monikathaâ€™ (Workshop based production with school children), â€˜Samudra Sowarâ€™, â€˜One-Twoâ€™, â€˜Ukiler Budhiâ€™, â€˜Asukha Sattyamâ€™, â€˜Fakir Sekher Galpoâ€™, â€˜Ghoton Kothay?â€™, â€˜Saatmaar Palowanâ€™ etc.However, Kathaprasanga has laid especial emphasis upon mime production too because mime being a very powerful art form, has an universal message of its own. Keeping this in mind we made use of it in our productions i. e. Ramayana, Man & Machine, Thief, Weight Lifter, Blind, etc. and this successions of plays were a success. Since 2005, KATHAPRASANGA organizing school children workshops which as part of the Theatre In Education. (T.I.E) programme, under the active guidance of Rudraprasad Sengupta & Swatilekha Sengupta (Nandikar, Kolkata). KATHAPRASANGA performed many prestigious Natya Festivals like Nandikarâ€™s National Theatre Festival, Natya Mela (organised by State Natya Academy, Govt. of West Bengal), Banipur Loko Utsav, etc. and others Natya Utsav in West Bengal. Now it is a reputed and reknowed Theatre Group in West Bengal. KATHA PRASANGA fervently believes that theatre is a platform where all art media can be and have to be used to intensify the message of the theatre, to make a support with the audience. So, our overall approach is never to copy any group or style blindly. But to stimulate the mind & consciousness of the generations of today who are going to be the shaper or the agent fo the future, before whom the abstract world of higher thoughts should be presented in a simple way through artistic presentations of personal, social & concrete situations. So that this humanistic art form would encourage their theatre activity, boost their awareness of values and create greater consciousness of their sense of culture, beauty, harmony and our quiet essential unity all sorts of diversities.

ngoList.title: Kayadanga Sabuj Sanskritic Kendra
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: KAYADANGA SABUJ SANSKRITIC KENDRA is a theatre organization, who has been working since 2004. We are not only doing the theatre but also have organized many workshops, projects, and national theatre festivals. Most of the team members are students and some of them are passed out students of RabindraBharati University (Drama Dept.). The director of this team is Rajesh Debnath who has not only completed his M.A. on direction from R.B.U. but also he has completed the direction workshop of N.S.D. KAYADANGA SABUJ SANSKRITIC KENDRA have a theatre institute, where we take classes on acting improvisation, body movement, mime, voice modulation and some other knowledge about theatre. We also have a children team with 15 children and a branch with 10 members. Every year we organize a national theatre festival, in which many well-known theatre groups as well as many well-known theatre personalities have attended the festival and given their valuable support. Mainly we work in Kolkata, north 24 parganas as well as in West Bengal and also out of Bengal. Though we are doing mainly proscenium theatre, but have already done two non-proscenium theatres by which we proved our good work. We have done workshops under Goutam Halder, Adrija Dasgupta, Ashis Chattopadhyay, Om PrakashKarna, Subhadip Guha and etc.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Khagenhat Welfare Organization (KWO) is a non-profit, non-religious, and non-governmental rural base organization, established in 2004. KWO is located at Khagenhat village of Falakata Development Block nearly 50 KMs distance from divisional town in Jalpaiguri and nearly 62 KMs distance from district Head Quarter Alipurduar. KWO has been playing an important role in rural development of West Bengal State. Khagenhat Welfare Organization covers 12 Gram Panchayats of Falakata Development Block, 16 Gram Panchayats and Municipality Area of Dhupguri Block, 16 Gram Panchayat of Maynaguri Block, 2 Gram Panchayat of Malbazar Block, 1 Gram Panchayat of Rajganj Block and 4 Gram Panchayats of Madarihat Block, of Jalpaiguri District, WB-India. Activities and achievement of Khagenhat Welfare Organization so far with the help of different funding Agencies are as follows Women Empowerment - With the cordial support of NABARD and Banks we have formed and made savings link in several bank branches total 750 Women Self Help Group in four blocks namely Dhupguri, Maynaguri, Malbazar and Jalpaiguri Sadar block of Jalpaiguri District under WSHG scheme which is being implementing in several back ward district in India. Throughout the WSHG Scheme Khagenhat Welfare Organisation brought approx 7700 Rural Women under Women Self Help Group. We motivated these groups to maintain Bank linkage, internal-loaning, bank loaning and to start income generation. These groups went through various Livelihood Training Programme and started income generation activities such as firm of goat rear, piggery, and dairy. We are on the track on conduct such training program so that they can upgrade their living standard. Members of women self help group are also confident and enthusiastic to help their family under WSHG umbrella. We conducted different livelihood Training Programme on need based trades with help of NABARD. Khagenhat Welfare Organization conducted LEDP programme in Jalpaiguri districts. This is Pilot project of NABARD. Total 8 trainings among these three trainings is for Mosquito Net Making under Handicrafts and RNFS activity and 5 trainings is for Kitchen Garden and Small animal rearing under agriculture and allied sector. Total 240 participants had been participated in this training programme and doing activities. The KWO this year conducted International Womenâ€™s Day on 8th March, 2017 at Dhupguri Roy Para with support of NABARD, Jalpaiguri. Formation of Farmers Club - The Khagenhat Welfare Organisation for improvement of agriculture base activity has been nurturing 30 Farmers Club in Jalpaiguri and 3 Farmers Club in Alipurduar District with support of NABARD. These Farmers Clubs were given training on contemporary modern and organic agriculture base technology. We have conducted Krishi Mela at different places. The main objective of these Krishi Mela is Technology Exhibition. Farmers of different places used to participate in these Krishi Mela. We conducted exposure visit of Farmers Club at Krishi Bijyan Kendra, North Bengal Agricultural University. Main purpose of exposure visit was to gather information regarding modern agriculture process. The expert of the institution gave knowledge and demonstrated several agriculture basis procedures to farmers. Improve Primary education of deaf children through Home Based and institutional Educational Support â€“With the support District Mass Education and Extension department, West Bengal Board of Primary Education, SSA and Deaf Child Worldwide Khagenhat Welfare Organisation provided education support to 241 deaf children at their premise. We enrolled in general school and also providing educational support through support centre. Sibling, Parents and Teacher of these children and community person are given training. In Falakata Block of Alipurduar District total 95 deaf children, in Jalpaiguri Sadar block total 76 deaf children and in Dhupguri block of Jalpaiguri District total 70 deaf children has been getting home education support. Parents of deaf children were trained during the time of home based educational support for their childâ€™s educational improvement. Games and Sports for Deaf â€“ During this year our four athlete person with disabilities, were participated in 21st National Games for Deaf at Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru stadium, Chennai Tamilnadu. They have won 1 silver and 3 Bronze medal in National Games for deaF.
